bio: The Graph organizes and makes usable web3 data for dapps via GraphQL.
contributionDescription:
The Graph has supported Optimism since the initial launch of mainnet. More on that here: https://thegraph.com/blog/graph-optimistic-ethereum/. 

Since Optimism mainnet launch, The Graph's hosted service, subsidized by The Graph ecosystem (meaning completely free for dapps) has served:

22.7B queries
1.15K subgraphs
with a 99.97% query success rate.

Over the past 30 days alone, The Graph has served 1.24B queries.
Also, The Graph supports Optimism Goerli and Kovan, and on testnet has served:

Goerli
1.24B queries
272 subgraphs
99.98% query success

Kovan
173M queries
154 subraphs
99.99% query success

contributionLinks.description: The UI/DX where Optimism developers and dapps are supported

impactDescription:
Many Optimism dapps rely fully on The Graph for a seamless UI experience to onboard and maintain users Optimism. Since Optimism mainnet launch, The Graph's hosted service, subsidized by The Graph ecosystem (meaning completely free for dapps) has served:

with a 99.97% query success rate.

Over the past 30 days alone, The Graph has served 1.24B queries.
Also, The Graph supports Optimism Goerli and Kovan, and on testnet has served:

fundingSources.description: Strategic funding round from web3 Investors

pwRecategorizeReason: NO, the application is incorrectly categorized as a "PROJECT" but should be "INDIVIDUAL" as the bio refers to a person "Director of Global Business at Edge & Node" instead of a project.
